message: We step through the entrance and come out into a bar area. Beyond is a big open floor. Loud, thumping music and strange scents assault my senses.
The room is dark. Flashes of fluorescent light illuminate the dancing, milling throngs.
I've never been in a nightclub before. So this is what it's like.
...Forget about that. Who is this dude?
I slip out of his grasp and look him over.

name: 竜峰
message: "Oh, sorry. Didn't mean to scare you."
The light strobes across his face. His expression is cool; he looks about my age, but he could be a decade older. It's hard to be sure.
He's wearing a kimono. It reminds me of Koujaku, though this man's is blue. He has a blue tattoo on his neck as well.
Though his smile is gentle, his eyes are sharp. For some reason, he makes me think of a fox.

name: 竜峰
message: "You looked like you needed some help. You wanted in, right? Was I wrong?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "I, uh... No, you were right."

name: 竜峰
message: "Great. I'm glad I could help."
He smiles sweetly and his fox-like eyes narrow even further. The expression is almost childish. I really can't get a read on his age.

name: 蒼葉
message: "I appreciate it, but you really didn't have to. I mean, why did you?"

name: 竜峰
message: "Why did I what?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Why did you get me in? You don't know me."

name: 竜峰
message: "True. I've never met you before in my life."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Then, why?"

name: 竜峰
message: "Why not? I was in a generous mood. Besides, it'd ruin my evening, knowing I left I guy out there in the cold."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Really?"

name: 竜峰
message: "Anyway, call it a whim. Forget it. This place is paradise. You should enjoy yourself. Oh, before I forget."
The man reaches into his sleeve and pulls out a card.

name: 竜峰
message: "This'll get you in from now on. Don't lose it."

name: 蒼葉
message: "But―"

name: 竜峰
message: "Oh, please. Be a good boy and take it."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Okay..."
He just won't take no for an answer.

name: 竜峰
message: "Well, I have things to do. See you 'round."
The man waves, then disappears into the crowd.

name: 蒼葉
message: "What the hell just happened?"

name: 蓮
message: "Are you sure he wasn't just a nice person?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "No, that was shady as hell. What am I supposed to do with this card?"

name: 蓮
message: "Just keep it for now. Or do you want to go after him to return it?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "I guess that would be pretty dumb."
He's the reason I got in here in the first place.
I tuck the card into my jacket pocket.
...Enough with the mystery man. I need to find Koujaku.
Weaving through the crowd of people swaying to the music, I start searching the dance floor.
It's hard to identify people in the flickering light.
Plus, there's something about the rhythm of the music...
The tempo is ever-so-slightly off, and I keep hearing this high-pitched grinding noise that seems to pierce straight through my skull.
My head starts to spin. I feel nauseous.
Goosebumps break out all over my body. I cover my mouth with my hand.
Shit, what's wrong with me?
How is everyone else fine with these sounds? These lights?
Looking around, I notice that everyone seems rapt, entranced.
There are people dancing half naked, and I think there are even some people having sex in a corner.
Wait, these lights...
Is this the thing I heard about back in the Old Residential District? A new drug craze. They call it... photonarcotics.
I'm not into that shit, so I don't really know a lot about it. Supposedly, it uses light to induce euphoria with no unpleasant side effects.
Whatever the case, it definitely isn't working for me. I feel awful.
The floor looks like it's covered with a purple mist, and I'm gradually losing my ability to distinguish it from the ceiling.

name: 蓮
message: "Are you okay?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "...I think I'm in trouble..."

name: 蓮
message: "Maybe you should sit down."
My vision is starting to blur. It's getting hard to stand.
I stagger toward the edge of the dance floor, but it feels like walking on jello.
Even so, I manage to make some progress...
...until my vision goes dark.
Huh?
